title: Drawing, 1952–69
medium: Red, black and blue colored pencil on white wove paper fastened to white cardboard with four staples
inscribed: Verso of cardboard mount in graphite upper left corner: II - 4; left side, two wavy lines, one red, one blue
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Alternating rows of squares and circles in positive/negative pattern. Color repeat: red/black/blue

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1952–69.
1952–69. Red, black and blue colored pencil on white wove paper fastened to white cardboard with four staples. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-422.
